The claim is based on Republic Act 11261: which was signed into law by Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte on April 10, 2019.
The law states that certain government d: including village clearance, birth certificate, marriage certificate, medical certificate, unified multipurpose ID, NBI clearance, police clearance, Tax Identification Number (TIN), and TOR issued by SUC, are now free of charge.
The waiver of fees only applies to first: time jobseekers who need the documents for an employment application, and they can only take advantage of the waiver once.
The claim has been shared multiple times: with misleading captions and translations, leading to its widespread dissemination.
